analyzed: de ste sems can mi brtan pa zhig yin na ni; 'di brtan por 'gyur bar bya'o snyam du bsam nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis yul der sems can mang po sprul nas sprul pa de dag gis blon po de dag la smras pa /
translated: If he is not a steadfast being, I will make him steadfast.” With this thought, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, emanated many beings in that land. Those emanations said to the ministers,🔽“

original: gal te rgyal po 'dis bdag cag zas dang skom gyis tshim par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyal po 'dis bdag cag zas dang skom gyis tshim par byed na ni /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag cag gis kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas blon po rnams kyis rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba la gsol to //

original: de nas rgyal po rnam par rgyal bas sprul pa de dag bkug ste bsgo ba /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po rnam par rgyal bas sprul pa de dag bkug ste bsgo ba /

analyzed: ngas khyed zas dang skom gyis tshim par bya'o //

original: sprul ba rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sprul ba rnams kyis smras pa /

original: bdag cag ni /
analyzed: bdag cag ni /

original: gsar du bsad pa'i mi sha ni /
analyzed: gsar du bsad pa'i mi sha ni /

original: za / mi khrag ni /
analyzed: za / mi khrag ni /

original: 'thung ngo // de nas rgyal pos bsam pa /🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'thung ngo // de nas rgyal pos bsam pa / 'di dag ni /
translated: Then the king thought,

original: mi ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ma yin te /

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /
translated: These are

original: mi ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa yin la /
translated: not humans.

original: sha dang khrag 'di lta bu ni /
analyzed: sha dang khrag 'di lta bu ni /
translated: Such flesh and blood

original: ma bsad kyi bar du mi rnyed do //
analyzed: ma bsad kyi bar du mi rnyed do //
translated: cannot be obtained without killing a human.”

analyzed: 'on kyang gal te 'di rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas par 'gyur na /

original: bdag gi sha dang khrag gis tshim par bya'o snyam du bsam nas byang chub sems dpa' des sprul pa rnams la @450b smras pa; gal te khyed dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas par byed na /

translated: “Having thought this, the bodhisattva said to the emanations, ‘If you take up and abide by the path of the ten virtuous actions,

original: ngas nga rang gi sha dang khrag gis tshim par bya'o /
analyzed: ngas nga rang gi sha dang khrag gis tshim par bya'o /
translated: I will satisfy you with my own flesh and blood.’

original: sprul pa rnams kyis smras pa /

translated: “As soon as he heard this, the bodhisattva cut his flesh from all over his body and gave it to them, and he made the aspiration for unsurpassed and perfect awakening:

original: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag 'jig rten long ba /
analyzed: kye ma dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag 'jig rten long ba /

original: 'dren pa med pa /
analyzed: 'dren pa med pa /
translated: a guide for the world,

analyzed: ston pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: “May I become a teacher, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Fully Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a Sugata,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur cig ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab nas sprul pa de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur cig ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam btab nas sprul pa de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod do //
translated: Having made this aspiration to supreme and complete awakening, he established all those emanations in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bsam pa /🔽byang chub sems dpa' 'dis ni /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bsam pa / byang chub sems dpa' 'dis ni /

analyzed: mchog tu dka' ba byas mod kyi /
translated: “This bodhisattva has done something extremely difficult.

original: 'on kyang bdag gis 'di'i lus snga mkho bzhin du 'gyur bar byed ma nus so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis 'di'i lus snga mkho bzhin du 'gyur bar byed ma nus so //

original: gzhan yang 'di'i spro ba bskyed dgos so snyam nas byang chub sems dpa' de la smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di'i spro ba bskyed dgos so snyam nas byang chub sems dpa' de la smras pa /
translated: Moreover, I must encourage his enthusiasm.” Thinking this, he said to the bodhisattva,🔽“Noble one, you have done something extremely difficult.

original: grogs po / khyod sha rnams gcod pa dang / chu ba dang / rtsa brang breng rnams gcod pa dang @451a *//
analyzed: grogs po / khyod sha rnams gcod pa dang / chu ba dang / rtsa brang breng rnams gcod pa dang @451a *//

analyzed: cung zad tsam yang sems mi dka' ba lta yod dam / byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: “Friend, do you not feel the slightest discomfort when your flesh is cut, your sinews severed, and your bones split apart?”

original: kye nga ni /
analyzed: kye nga ni /
translated: The bodhisattva replied, “No, I do not.

original: sha rnams gcod pa dang / chu ba dang / rtsa brang breng rnams gcod pa na cung zad kyang sems mi dga' ba med de /
analyzed: sha rnams gcod pa dang / chu ba dang / rtsa brang breng rnams gcod pa na cung zad kyang sems mi dga' ba med de /
translated: “Friend, when my flesh is cut, my sinews severed, and my bones split apart, I do not feel the slightest discomfort.

original: bdag nyid phongs pa mthong na lhag par yang sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags su skye ba'i sems can rnams la snying rje skyes so //🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /

translated: When I see my own suffering, I feel even more compassion for sentient beings who are born as hell beings, animals, and anguished spirits.”

original: grogs po / khyod ji ltar yid ches par rung /🔽byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: grogs po / khyod ji ltar yid ches par rung / byang chub sems dpas smras pa /

analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rang bzhin gyi gzugs su bsgyur te rkang pa la phyag btsal nas bzod par gsol te /

analyzed: grogs po / khyod la ngas gtse ba'i bsam pas gnod pa byas pa bzod par mdzod cig /

translated: Having said this, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, disappeared on the spot.

translated: “Monks,

analyzed: ji snyam du sems /

translated: Later, he came to have faith in the Buddha, faith in the Dharma, and faith in the Saṅgha. He went for refuge, took the fundamental precepts, and began to give gifts and make merit.

original: de'i khyim de khron pa dang 'dra bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i khyim de khron pa dang 'dra bar gyur te /
translated: His house became like a well.

analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du de'i khyim du dge 'dun gyi phyir bskos pa'i dge slong rnams zan za'o //
translated: Every day, the monks who were appointed to eat in the house of the householder ate there.

original: de nas phyi zhig na khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na khyim bdag des sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs te /
translated: One day, the householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to his house.

original: des de dag la bza' ba dang bca' ba gtsang ma bzang po mang pos tshim par byas te ci bzhed pa bstabs nas bcom ldan 'das bshos gsol zin te /🔽bsang sder ni /

translated: He satisfied them with many good, wholesome foods, proffering all that they wished. When the Blessed One had finished eating,

analyzed: gyu / phyag ni /🔽bcabs par rig nas @452a *//
translated: the bowls were taken away,🔽and the householder knew that the Blessed One had washed his hands and put his bowl away.

analyzed: stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te chos mnyan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug go /
translated: He then sat down in front of the Blessed One on a very low seat in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / shes pa dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas de dang mthun pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, capacity, and nature, taught him the Dharma accordingly.

original: des na khyim bdag des stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis de la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: des na khyim bdag des stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta pa'i ri'i rtse mo mthon po nyi shu ye shes rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: As a result, the householder destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where he sat.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: The Blessed One then instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted him with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: He then rose from his seat and departed.

original: de nas phyi zhig na dge slong gsar bu dgra bcom pa zhig khyim der dge 'dun gyi phyir bskos pa'i mchod ston gyi res la bab ste 'ongs so //
analyzed: de nas phyi zhig na dge slong gsar bu dgra bcom pa zhig khyim der dge 'dun gyi phyir bskos pa'i mchod ston gyi res la bab ste 'ongs so //
translated: Later, a newly ordained arhat monk came to that house for his turn to receive a meal offering designated for the saṅgha.

original: de phyi bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi sna la gtogs pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba zhig kyang 'ongs so //
analyzed: de phyi bzhin du gtsug lag khang gi sna la gtogs pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba zhig kyang 'ongs so //
translated: A nonreturner who was a caretaker of a monastery also came along behind him.

original: de nas khyim bdag des de gnyis la zan sbyin par byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bsam pa /🔽dge slong des ni /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des de gnyis la zan sbyin par byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus bsam pa / dge slong des ni /
translated: Then the householder prepared food for those two. The Venerable Śāriputra thought,🔽“That monk will not be able to recite the benefits of generosity to that householder.”

original: khyim bdag de la yon gyi rabs gdon par mi nus so snyam nas khyim de'i nang du song ste  bstan bshams pa la 'dug nas dge slong des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la @452b gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag de la yon gyi rabs gdon par mi nus so snyam nas khyim de'i nang du song ste  bstan bshams pa la 'dug nas dge slong des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la @452b gsol ba btab ste /
translated: So he went into the house and sat down on the seat that had been prepared. The monk requested the Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gnas brtan / yon gyi rabs gdon par gsol zhes byas so //
analyzed: gnas brtan / yon gyi rabs gdon par gsol zhes byas so //
translated: “Elder, please recite the benefits of generosity.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim der yon gnas tshogs pa mthong nas de kho na dang mthun pa'i yon gyi rabs bton nas bdag gis ni /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim der yon gnas tshogs pa mthong nas de kho na dang mthun pa'i yon gyi rabs bton nas bdag gis ni /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, seeing that the assembly of worthy recipients was complete in that house, recited the verses of the gift in accordance with that, saying:

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'i tshad rgyas par brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu'i tshad rgyas par brjod par mi nus so //
translated: I cannot describe in detail the extent of the fruit of giving.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
